title: Patient Name
instruction: Extract only the patient's full name. If no patient name is explicitly stated, use the default value. Do not invent a name.

title: Chief Complaint
instruction: State the patient's primary reason for visit concisely. Avoid direct quotes, additional context, or filler. End with a period.

title: History of Present Illness
content: She had surgery for shoulder injury. She reports improved symptoms compared to previous visits. Still experiencing some stickiness in her arm, difficulty putting hand on the ground, but decreased numbness and tingling. Moving well.
instruction: Summarize the patient's current illness. Include symptom onset, duration, severity, modifying factors, and prior treatments. Use precise medical terminology and complete sentences. Do not use direct speech, filler words, or first-person phrasing. Ensure medical terminology and grammar are correct. End each sentence with a period.

title: Past Medical History
instruction: List all relevant prior diagnoses, surgeries, and hospitalizations not related to the current complaint. Maintain a professional tone. Do not include current issues or treatment plans. End each sentence with a period.

title: Current Medications
instruction: List all current medications. Include name (generic/brand if known), dose, route, frequency, and duration. Format clearly. If none, use default. End each item with a period.

title: Family History
instruction: Mention relevant family medical conditions. Specify relationship and age at diagnosis if provided. If no family history is stated, return the default. End each sentence with a period.

title: Social History
instruction: Include occupation, living situation, and habits (e.g., smoking, alcohol, drug use, relevant sexual history). Use professional language. End each sentence with a period.

title: Allergies
instruction: List all mentioned medication, food, or environmental allergies. If none, return the default. End each item with a period.

title: HEENT
content: Eyes: Normal. Ears, Nose, Throat: Normal.
default: Eyes: No visual loss, blurred vision, double vision. Ears, Nose, Throat: No hearing loss, sneezing, congestion, runny nose or sore throat.
instruction: Summarize patient-reported symptoms for HEENT. If no relevant info, use the default. Do not fabricate details. End each sentence with a period.

title: Skin
instruction: Document specific physical exam findings related to skin. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: CARDIOVASCULAR
instruction: Summarize patient-reported cardiovascular symptoms. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: Respiratory
instruction: Summarize patient-reported respiratory symptoms. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: GASTROINTESTINAL
instruction: Summarize patient-reported gastrointestinal symptoms. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: GENITOURINARY
instruction: Summarize patient-reported genitourinary symptoms. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: NEUROLOGICAL
instruction: Summarize patient-reported neurological symptoms. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: Constitutional
instruction: Summarize patient-reported constitutional symptoms (e.g., fever, fatigue, weight changes). Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: MUSCULOSKELETAL
instruction: Summarize patient-reported musculoskeletal symptoms or injuries. This section is for Review of Systems (patient-reported). Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: Hematologic
instruction: Summarize patient-reported hematologic symptoms. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: Lymphatic
instruction: Summarize patient-reported lymphatic symptoms. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: Psychiatric
instruction: Summarize patient-reported psychiatric concerns. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: Eye
instruction: Document specific physical exam findings for eyes. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: General
instruction: Document general physical exam findings and vital signs. If not specified, return 'Normal'. End each sentence with a period.

title: Head
instruction: Document specific physical exam findings for the head. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: MUSCULOSKELETAL
content: Scar: Mild. Pillar Pain: Mild. Active Extension: No pain. Hand-on-Ground Discomfort: Some.
instruction: Document specific physical exam findings for the musculoskeletal system. This section is for Physical Exam (objective findings). Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: Neurological
instruction: Document specific physical exam findings for the neurological system. Return 'Normal' if not mentioned. End each sentence with a period.

title: Psychiatric

title: Immunizations
instruction: List all mentioned vaccinations, including type and date if available. If none, use the default. End each item with a period.

title: Lab Results
instruction: Include only completed lab tests: type, date, and result. Do not list recommended or pending labs. Do not repeat diagnoses. End each item with a period.

title: Assessment and Plan
content: She is improving. Her symptoms have decreased since last visit. She can move well now. However, she still experiences some discomfort while performing activities such as placing her hand on the ground. The surgical site shows minimal scarring and there is no evidence of active inflammation or infection.

Plan: Advancing activity level. She should continue with her home exercise program targeting pillar pain. Follow-up appointment scheduled in three months to monitor progress and adjust treatment plan accordingly.
instruction: Provide a structured summary of diagnosis, reasoning, and treatment plan. Exclude all follow-up instructions. End each sentence with a period.

title: Follow Up
content: Monitor progress and adjust treatment plan accordingly.
instruction: Document all follow-up timing, purpose, and review plans. Do not include assessment or treatment details. End each sentence with a period.
